intro: Psychotria foetida, commonly known as the stinkwood or the devil's weed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, glossy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant contains various alkaloids, including psychotrine, which has been of interest in ethnobotanical and pharmacological studies. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its toxic properties, it is generally avoided by livestock and humans alike.
